snippet: Clear Channel will pay royalties for the first time to performers and a record label when songs are played on its radio stations. In return for the record label, Warner Music, will discount the high cost to stream music online.
abstract: Clear Channel Communications announces deal with Warner Music Group that for first time will allow label and its acts to collect royalties when their songs are played on Clear Channel's 850 broadcast stations; in exchange Clear Channel will receive a favorable rate in the growing but expensive world of online streaming.
lead_paragraph: Clear Channel will pay royalties for the first time to performers and a record label when songs are played on its radio stations. In return for the record label, Warner Music, will discount the high cost to stream music online.

headline.main: Clear Channel-Warner Music Deal Rewrites the Rules on Royalties
headline.print_headline: Clear Channel-Warner Music Deal Rewrites the Rules on Royalties
